sentences.en: Both quantum mechanics and chaos theory suggest a world constantly in flux.
sentences.cn: 量子力学和混沌理论都表明世界永远处于不断变化中。

sentences.en: Economic theory suggests that the devalued pound will boost the economy.
sentences.cn: 经济学理论指出贬值的英镑将会促进经济的发展。

sentences.en: Einstein formulated the Theory of Relativity in 1905.
sentences.cn: 爱因斯坦于1905年创立了相对论。

sentences.en: Einstein had the chutzpah to discard common sense and long-established theory.
sentences.cn: 爱因斯坦敢于抛弃常识和长期公认的理论。

sentences.en: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
sentences.cn: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

sentences.en: He was an unswerving empiri-cist with little time for theory.
sentences.cn: 他是个坚定不移的经验论者，不屑研究理论。

sentences.en: I have this theory that most people prefer being at work to being at home.
sentences.cn: 依我看，多数人喜欢工作而不愿待在家里。

sentences.en: in theory, things can only get better; in practice, they may well become a lot worse.
sentences.cn: 理论上情况只会变好，实际上却很可能变得更糟。

sentences.en: It's only a theory, admittedly, but the pieces fit together.
sentences.cn: 诚然，这只是一种理论，但各部分互相吻合。

sentences.en: John Bardeen was also co-developer of the theory of superconductivity.
sentences.cn: 约翰·巴丁也是超导电性理论的创立者之一。

sentences.en: Last night a top criminal psychologist cast doubt on the theory.
sentences.cn: 昨天晚上，一位顶级犯罪心理学家使人们对该理论产生了怀疑。

sentences.en: Tell me, what do you think of my theory?
sentences.cn: 你说说,我的理论怎么样?

sentences.en: The book's aim was to make economic theory more digestible.
sentences.cn: 该书的目的是要让经济学理论更加简单易懂。

sentences.en: The Liverpool team are now putting their theory to the test.
sentences.cn: 利物浦队此时正在验证他们的理论。

sentences.en: There were, however, a number of crucial flaws in his monetary theory.
sentences.cn: 但是，他的货币理论中存在若干关键性错误。

sentences.en: This theory bears no relation to reality.
sentences.cn: 这个理论和现实没什么联系。

sentences.en: We shall first look briefly at the historical antecedents of this theory.
sentences.cn: 我们首先应大致看一下该理论在历史上的前身。

words.tran_cn: 理论的；理论上的；假设的；推理的
理论家，精通于理论的人

trans.tran_en: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true
